definition: bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: And Vergeer admits that "sometimes it's tiring always trying to improve.
sentences.chinese: 沃吉尔承认，“有时会对无尽的提高而感到厌烦。”

sentences.english: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
sentences.chinese: 你的脚要少进邻舍的家，恐怕他厌烦你，恨恶你。

sentences.english: I'm tired of your perpetual nag ging .
sentences.chinese: 我对你无休止的唠叨厌烦了。

sentences.english: I used to be upset by these attempts to ingratiate .
sentences.chinese: 我以前常常对这样的“讨好”感到厌烦。

sentences.english: The actor's soliloquies were all very boring.
sentences.chinese: 演员的全部独白都是十分令人厌烦的。

sentences.english: Zhou, who had first put that idea forward, hid his boredom behind an indulgent smile.
sentences.chinese: 最早提出这个概念的周以宽容的微笑掩盖了他的厌烦。

sentences.english: The sound of music allured him into the party.
sentences.chinese: 我对整天听那音乐感到厌烦。

sentences.english: As soon as the crowd starts to fidget change the music.
sentences.chinese: 一旦人群开始出现厌烦情绪，就改变曲目。

sentences.english: I'm sick of13 having something to do all the time and all I really want is to have some time of.
sentences.chinese: 我厌烦总要做这做那，我想要的就是有自己的时间。

sentences.english: I pass over many other things peculiar to this island, lest I should weary you.
sentences.chinese: 我略过这个岛上很多奇怪的事情，免得我让你厌烦。

sentences.english: I was back on the physical irks , but now do not they became a physics teacher?
sentences.chinese: 我当年对物理很厌烦，可现在不也当了个物理老师吗？

sentences.english: We are bored by the speaker's tedious talk.
sentences.chinese: 讲演者那冗长乏味的讲话使我们感到厌烦。

sentences.english: And take a Life that wearies me.
sentences.chinese: 死神，把厌烦我的生命攫取。

sentences.english: Their stories were simply too boring.
sentences.chinese: 他们的故事太令人厌烦了。

definition: bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
tired of/fed up/sick/(of a person) to annoy/tiresome
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
